appearances.snippet: new jersey republican congressman jefferson van drew praise efforts to stop drugs from coming to the u.s.. i do not see how anybody can ever defend. drug cartels, but many democrats say they still have questions about the future of operations in venezuela after the u.s. ousted its president, nicolas maduro, legal justification and saw really lacking connecticut democratic senator richard blumenthal left a briefing on the operation in venezuela, calling for more transparency. administration needs come clean with the american people about what its objectives and plans are. >> other than expecting a lot oil. but oklahoma republican senator markwayne mullin said he's proud of america's service members and understands why congress wasn't consulted. they can afford to put our men and women. >> in danger because of someone that wanted to go and get the story. the senate is expected to vote this week on a resolution to prevent further military action against venezuela without a vote of congress. >> last week, 5 republicans voted to move that measure forward in washington. i'm maddie pierre t

appearances.title: U.S. House of Representatives U.S. House of Representatives : CSPAN : January 9, 2026 9:00am-12:32pm EST
appearances.snippet: and so that's why i'm introducing the course credit act with representative jefferson van drew. this common sense bipartisan legislation directs the department of education to collect and publish detailed information on ap and ib credit policies at colleges and universities. it also requires colleges and universities to publish the same information on their own websites. this will give students, families, and counselors a quick and easy way to see how much credit they will receive for their ap and ib exams at any given college, and allows students to choose a school where they can make the most of their hard earned credit. so thank you. and i yield back. >> for what purpose. >> does the gentleman from california seek recognition? >> speaker i ask unanimous consent to address the house for. >> one week. without objection, the gentleman is recognized for one minute. >> mr. speaker, ice has gone rogue. i was sickened to see an ice officer shoot a 37 year old mother leaving her six year old an orphan. that officer needs to be arrested and prosecuted. and, mr. speaker, i'm concerned
